message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.MM 

The paper presents a framework for real-time semantic segmentation using learned feature representations. This involves optimizing the weights, shapes, and sparsities of the filters used for feature extraction. This topic is closely related to computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) as it involves learning representations for image segmentation. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of an iterative optimization algorithm, which is a common technique in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The proposed method is also applicable to robotics (cs.RO) as it can be used for real-time segmentation in robotic vision systems. Finally, the paper presents results on a hand segmentation dataset, which is related to multimedia (cs.MM) as it involves processing and analyzing visual data.
